Subject: Re: [junit] AssertionFailedError: No tests found in (snipped)....env.db.MyValidation














Hi Thomas,



On 10/22/07, Thomas SMETS <smetsthomas@ yahoo.com> wrote:

> My specific class relies on its parent to execute most of the hard work

>

> public class DB1Validation extends DBValidation {

>

> public String ds = "jdbc/DB1";

>

> public static final TestSuite suite()

> {

> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(DB1Valida tion.class) ;

> String[] tables = new String[]

> {"ERRORS", "ERROR_CODES" , "EVENTS", "MASKS" };

>

> suite.addTest( validateAllTable s(tables) );

>

> return suite;

> }

> }

>

> If I don't create a suite-method, the code DB1Validation invokes the

> parent test (accessDBSuccessful l) successfully. If I do create a suite

> method as indicated, I get the following error :

> <pre>

> junit.framework. AssertionFailedE rror: No tests found in (snipped)

> .env.db.DB1Validati on



What is happening is that JUnit 4's backwards compatibility kicks in

when it sees a suite() method in the test class. It then proceeds to

look for test methods defined with the JUnit 3.8-style signatures

rather than based on the JUnit 4 annotations.



Lasse
